abstract.p: Westchester County (NY) residents can recycle old computers in working condition at county recycling office, which will make them available at no charge to those who need them (S)

block.p: Rather than discarding old computers, residents can now recycle them. Old computers in working condition are available at no charge to those who need them. To get rid of equipment that no longer works, residents should call the county's Recycling Office at (914) 637-3049. To give away working equipment, residents can list it on the County's Web site at westchestergov.com. Those interested can look up the ''Used But Usable Clearinghouse'' section on the Web site, or call (914) 637-3011. The program was developed with the help of an Ardsley High School senior, Michael Herman, who was a county intern this summer
